summary: Conducting research on the impact of media on election outcomes. Used Python to extract Tanzanian parliamentary election results from a government-provided PDF.

Analyzed survey data collected from field research using Stata. Built a dashboard in Tableau to visualize the survey data. Made corrections to survey data entered by enumerators based on feedback from the QC team. Conducted research to assess whether an NGO's problem statement was relevant to their initiative.

Developed the iOS app Peer2Power to facilitate a randomized control trial evaluating the impact friend-to-friend recruiting has on willingness to volunteer for political campaigns. I wrote the app in SwiftUI while another student wrote a web version of the app. The app shipped on the App Store. Preliminary analysis suggested we achieved a statistically significant result.

Conducted desk research on One Health, a public health approach that emphasizes the intersection between human, animal, and environmental health to identify opportunities available to provide services. My findings were featured in a [company blog post.](https://www.public.io/blog-post/from-policy-to-product-enabling-one-health-through-technology)
